intro: Malvaviscus leucocarpus, commonly known as white apple berry, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically white or yellow when ripe, which are edible and have a mild, sweet flavor. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. The plant's ornamental value and edible fruits make it a notable species in both horticulture and local diets.
